startFire: Used t' start a fire. Use on campfires, furnaces, etc. t' light them or on an empty tile. Usin' this action may require kindling, tinder and a fuel item in yer duffle dependin' on th' circumstance.
carve: Used t' carve creature corpses or t' remove objects attached t' th' ground.
setDown: Usin' this item will place it on top o' whatever tile be present in yer facin' direction. This be different than just droppin' th' item. It can also be used t' extinguish fires.
eat: Consumed on use. May provide benefits t' hunger, thirst, health and stamina; however, may reduce them as well dependin' on th' food.
drinkItem: Consumed on use. Will reduce yer thirst; however, will provide negative effects when drinkin' sea/unpurified water.
rest: Used t' rest fer a period o' time t' regain health and stamina. Ye will belay restin' when reachin' full stamina.
sleep: Used t' sleep fer a period o' time t' regain health and stamina. Duration be based on campin' skill and time o' day. A bonus t' all effects (includin' length) will be granted if facin' a fire or lit object. Hunger and dehydration increase slower while sleepin'.
heal: Consumed on use. Used t' restore a varied amount o' health.
dig: Used t' dig up resources and items from th' ground.
paddle: Used t' travel over water without gettin' yer feet wet. Yer speed be not reduced in water while paddlin'.
gatherWater: Used t' gather water into th' item.
shoot: Ye can shoot arrows with this item.
cast: Come across a fish in a body o' water and attempt t' cast yer line or net t' catch it.
traverseTheSea: Used t' travel t' new, unexplored lands, leavin' behind yer current surroundings.
sling: Ye can sling bullets with this item.
repair: Use while facin' a damaged item t' attempt t' repair it. Success based on skill used t' make th' item.
decode: Used fer attemptin' t' read th' map. Use by th' booty location t' reveal how far or close ye be.
read: Consumed on use. Readin' usually provides useful knowledge.
reinforce: Consumed on use. Use while facin' a damaged item t' attempt t' increase th' overall maximum and minimum durability. Success based on skill used t' make th' item.
gather: Can be used directly t' gather from an adjacent resource tile/object. Gatherin' will attempt t' gather everything, destroyin' th' plant or mushroom in th' process.
stokeFire: Used on a fire source t' increase th' strength o' th' flame.
pour: Pour on fire t' extinguish th' flames, pour inside a water still t' begin water filtration, pour on a suitable plant t' increase its health, or just simply empty out.
plant: Attempts t' plant th' item on th' tile ye be facin' towards. Some plants may require certain ground types or conditions t' be planted.
gatherTreasure: Attempt t' gather booty in th' vicinity o' use based on a decoded treasure map. Range o' gather be dependent on yer minin' skill.
ignite: Use this item on a fire source t' start it on fire.
build: Attempt t' construct or assemble th' item on th' tile ye be facin' towards.
openContainer: Usin' this will open it whar ye may drag and drop items t' and from. Weight reduction and decay reduction bonuses may apply t' items inside.
preserve: Used with food items t' extend their life and decay rate.
openBottle: Consumed on use. Usin' this will open it, providin' new and unknown items.
drinkCure: Consumed on use. Used t' cure poisonin' while sometimes providin' other health benefits.
tellTime: Used t' measure th' time o' day or night.
sailToCivilization: After collectin' all th' pieces o' booty, ye can return t' civilization and bask in th' glory o' yer swag and fame. Ye can always return back t' these lands afterwards.
transmogrify: Use while facin' an equippable item t' attempt t' infuse with magical properties.
fire: Usin' a mixture o' black powder along with a bullet, ye may fire this weapon.
teleport: With a flick o' th' wand, teleport t' a location in front o' whar ye be facin'.
extinguish: Douse th' torch, extinguishin' th' flame.
drawMap: Draw a map usin' yer skill in cartography o' th' surroundin' area.
pourOnYourself: Liquid be consumed on use. Used t' sooth burn injuries.
squeeze: Consumed on use. Spews a stream o' fire in yer facin' direction.
healCreature: Consumed on use. Used t' restore a varied amount o' health t' a creature.
rubClockwise: Rubbin' this item manifests its effects t' th' holder.
rubCounterclockwise: Rubbin' this item manifests its effects t' th' holder.
grasp: Used t' loot items usin' another item fer safety reasons such as graspin' items in a fire.
till: Use while facin' a tile ye wish t' till, grantin' it properties fer better plant growth.
harvest: Can be used t' harvest an adjacent plant or mushroom without destroyin' th' plant itself.

slime: A bouncin' globule o' animated gelatin. It be not aware o' yer stirrin'.
jellyCube: An animated cube o' gelatin. Its body jiggles to-and-fro as it moves towards ye with hostile intent.
giantSpider: A gangly, frightful arachnid with th' ability t' poison you.
bear: A hulkin' carnivorous mammal attracted t' yer scent. A deadly foe without protection.
rabbit: A fast moving, peaceful herbivorous mammal. Useful fer a good meal or as a pet.
snake: A slithering, poisonous reptile. Appears ambivalent t' yer encroachment.
giantRat: A rat o' unusual size with sharp claws and piercin' teeth. Keep at a distance without equipment.
rat: A small and scurryin' rodent. Afraid o' predators, it will try t' escape yer grasp.
vampireBat: A flyin' mammal with large rubbery wings. Appears t' have a penchant fer human blood.
greyWolf: A tall canid animal. Able t' tear into flesh with vicious abandon.
imp: An odd hoverin' creature with thick wrinkled skin and sharp claws.
bogling: A foul, sulphurous-smellin' writhin' mass o' vegetation, seemingly animated and alive.
livingRock: A massive pile o' rocks and minerals that appears t' be alive, or semi-aware at least.
shark: A large blood-thirsty cartilaginous sea creature. Its fin juts from th' waters, tauntin' you.
zombie: A slow, but strong foul-smellin' undead or diseased human. Appears t' dislike th' sun.
skeleton: An animated pile o' human, or human-like bones.
pirateGhost: A glowing, ethereal visage o' a pirate. It appears t' be able t' manifest a physical weapon t' attack you.
timeSkitter: An unusual spider-like creature that appears t' be able t' move through solid objects and move at incredible speeds.
chicken: A flightless fowl that seems fearful o' yer presence. Produces feathers, cackle fruit, meat, and more.
trapdoorSpider: A large spider that appeared from an underground dwellin' as ye stumbled over it.
fireElemental: A creature that be seemingly composed o' only fire. Appears t' spread fire and destruction in its wake.
cod: A common ocean fish, known fer it's nutritionally-dense, flaky white flesh.
hobgoblin: An odd-lookin' humanoid. Dislikes yer presence and appears t' know how t' use traps.
livingMushroom: A livin' mycological abomination. It appears t' have a vengeful attitude towards you.
kraken: A wiry mass o' thick tentacles, this lumberin' sea-giant be angered by yer existence.
blindfish: A cave-dwelling, sightless fish. Hard t' see in detail within th' murky briny depths.
harpy: A large and unusual avian creature. Hostile t' yer presence.
acidSpitterDemon: A small, but fierce demonic-lookin' creature with sharp claws. Appears t' spit an acidic fluid.
skeletalMage: A robed, magic-castin' skeletal humanoid. It appears t' hold a wand; flickin' it t' cast its spells.
clawWorm: A wrigglin' creature with a massive claw-mouth, spawned forth from th' ground due t' vibrations caused by yer gatherin'.
drake: A massive flightless lizard-dragon with large scales and th' ability t' breath fire. A fearsome foe.
goat: A hardy ruminant animal that has horns. A frisky, lively creature, but dangerous when provoked, rammin' at its target with much force.

woodenDoor: A sturdy door, used t' keep unwanted creatures out.
woodenFence: A set o' panels, usually used t' keep creatures inside.
woodenWall: A wall crafted by connectin' wooden logs together.
sandstoneWall: A robust wall created from holystone.
setExplosiveTrap: An elaborate trap, ready t' be triggered and exploded by touch.
setDeadfall: A constructed deadfall, ready t' fall and crush a creature.
setSnare: A constructed snare, ready t' trap a creature's appendage.
setHobgoblinSnare: A hobgoblin constructed snare, ready t' catch yer feet or an unsuspectin' creature.
solarStill: A constructed solar still, desalinatin' water through evaporation.
woodenChest: A chest used fer stockpilin' items and preservin' food.
lockedWoodenChest: A locked chest, too heavy t' move. Able t' be broken or lockpicked.
creatureIdol: An odd mass o' organs. A hum emanates from it, seemingly attractin' creatures.
grass: A small mound o' growin' grass.
clematis: A wiry tangle o' thin vines with leaves.
milkThistles: A couple milk thistles, known fer their medicinal properties.
buttonMushrooms: A few possibly edible common-lookin' white mushrooms.
switchgrass: A collection o' long grass, suitable fer cordage.
badderlocks: A gatherin' o' long seaweed, useful fer eatin' or cordage.
chives: A bunch o' bright green chives planted in t' th' ground.
pileOfRocks: A mass o' rocks, stuck into th' ground.
raspberryBush: A small bush, bearin' small amounts o' raspberries.
beggarticks: A groupin' o' bright yellow medicinal flowers.
cotton: A white and fluffy cotton plant, an indispensable plant fer fiber.
pricklyPears: Spined cacti, known fer its edible fruit and pads with their pointy needles.
deadBush: A sparse, dried out mass o' twigs.
stoneWaterStill: A stone water still, ready t' be lit t' desalinate water.
litStoneWaterStill: A lit stone water still, desalinatin' water through evaporation.
stoneCampfire: An organized circle o' rocks, used t' contain a fire.
litStoneCampfire: A lit fire inside an enclosure o' rocks.
sandstoneKiln: A high-temperature fire enclosure made from holystone.
litSandstoneKiln: A lit holystone kiln, ready fer firin' items.
stoneFurnace: A rock furnace fer creatin' an enclosed high-temperature fire.
litStoneFurnace: A lit stone furnance, ready t' be used in production.
torchStand: A torch stuck in th' ground, ready fer being lit t' provide illumination.
litTorchStand: A torch stuck in th' ground and lit on fire.
stoneAnvil: A stone anvil used primarily fer metalworkin' and used in conjunction with a fire source.
acid: A neon-green ooze; boilin' and bubblin' into th' ground.
caveEntrance: An entrance into th' the dark caverns below.
woodenDoorOpen: An open door, allowin' anythin' t' enter.
woodenGateOpen: An opened gate, allowin' anythin' t' escape or enter.
poisonIvy: A creepin' plant with leaves o' three.
wroughtIronChest: A large chest, used fer storage and keepin' edibles fresher.
ironChest: An iron container fer storin' items and reducin' food decay.
ornateWoodenChest: A decorative chest used fer storin' items and preservin' perishables.
skeletalRemains: A pile o' bones that appear t' be stirrin'.
litClayKiln: A lit clay kiln, ready fer firin' items.
clayCampfire: An organized circle o' clay bricks, used t' contain a fire.
litClayCampfire: A lit fire inside an enclosure o' clay bricks.
clayFurnace: A clay furnace fer creatin' an enclosed high-temperature fire.
litClayFurnace: A lit clay furnance, ready t' be used in production.
clayWaterStill: A clay water still, ready t' be lit t' desalinate water.
litClayWaterStill: A lit clay water still, desalinatin' water through evaporation.
sandstoneCampfire: An organized circle o' holystone, used t' contain a fire.
litSandstoneCampfire: A lit fire inside an enclosure o' holystone.
sandstoneFurnace: A holystone furnace fer creatin' an enclosed high-temperature fire.
litSandstoneFurnace: A lit holystone furnance, ready t' be used in production.
sandstoneWaterStill: A holystone water still, ready t' be lit t' desalinate water.
litSandstoneWaterStill: A lit holystone water still, desalinatin' water through evaporation.
litStoneKiln: A lit stone kiln, ready fer firin' items.
wroughtIronAnvil: A wrought iron anvil, used fer blacksmithin' with a fire source.
ironAnvil: An iron anvil used fer metalworkin'. Used in addition with a fire source.
mapleTree: A common maple tree, known fer its distinctive leaf and seed shape.
appleTree: A deciduous tree known fer its sweet, pomaceous fruit; th' apple.
spruceTree: A large and robust spruce tree. Known fer its whorled branches and conical form.
cypressTree: A tall and gangly conifer tree. Although sparse in foliage, it makes up fer it with healthy supply o' hardwood.
coconutTree: A tall palm tree, able t' produce life-sustainin' coconut fruit when mature.
lettuce: An edible leafy plant that could almost be mistaken fer a weed when growin'.
potatoPlant: Unassumin' leaves pokin' out o' th' ground, revealin' just th' tips o' edible tubers underneath.
carrots: A groupin' o' green stalky leaves pokin' out o' th' ground, revealin' just th' tips o' their root vegetable below ground.
cornStalks: Th' tall stalks o' maize, producin' ears o' edible sweet kernels.
cucumberPlant: A creepin' cucumber vine, known fer producin' soft, water-rich gourds.
sugarCaneStalks: Tall, hardy stalks o' sugar cane. Can be harvested fer chewin' or refinin' into sugar.
wheat: A long grass, cultivated fer its protein-rich cereal grain when dried.

welcomeToWayward:
Welcome t' th' Early Access version o' Wayward! Wayward be currently in beta status and many things will change and improve over time. Hint windows like these will display as ye play th' game if enabled. Ye can disable automatic hints by clickin' th' button "Disable Hints" below or in th' options. If ye need further help or hints, visit th' Steam Discussions forums.

If ye want t' keep up with Wayward, please visit th' Wayward Blog or Subreddit.

Want t' help Wayward, savvy? Spread th' word, or follow us on one o' th' followin' sites: Facebook, Twitter, or IndieDB.
controls:
Keybinds can be changed under "Keybinds" in th' options menu.

Window Shortcuts


{ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Escape)} = Close Menus and Windows, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Inventory)} = Duffle, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Equipment)} = Equipment, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Crafting)} = Crafting, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Help)} = Help, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Skills)} = Skills, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Messages)} = Messages, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Options)} = Options, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Actions)} = Actions, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Milestones)} = Milestones

Movement


T' move, ye can t' use {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Up)}, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Left)}, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Down)}, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Right)} or by clicking/tappin' on th' game screen in th' direction ye want t' move. T' skip/pass a turn, or t' pick up item(s) on th' tile ye be standin' on, press th' spacebar or left click/tap yer character on th' game screen.

Actions


Openin' up th' Actions menu will bring up a list o' actions ye can perform on th' adjacent tile or object; fer example, collectin' a pineapple without needin' t' carve it up. Jumpin' be also selectable in th' actions menu which can help ye get out o' tight spots, but watch out fer th' heavy stamina reduction; it's based on yer current weight.

Usin' Items


T' use an item, ye may right click/tap it t' bring up th' item's menu. Ye will see a list o' actions ye can perform. Additionally, ye be able t' drag and drop an item into one o' th' quickslots. Press th' number or hotkey ({ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.One)}, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Two)}, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Three)}, etc.) that corresponds with which quickslot it be attached t' perform th' primary action fer th' item (unless changed).

Item Uses, Droppin' and Information


Some items have more than one use - these will show up in th' item's menu if available. Ye be able t' shift + right click an item t' automatically drop it without goin' into th' item menu. If ye be facin' a container, ye will drop th' item inside. Ye can use th' "Drop All" option from th' item's menu t' drop multiple items. Ye be also able t' shift + right click on th' game screen t' reveal information about what ye be clickin' on (referred t' as "Inspect"), whether it be items, creatures, tiles, and more.

More Information


Hoverin' over elements on screen will typically reveal more information. Tool-tips will appear over items. Hoverin' over craftin' items will highlight items used in th' craft.

Item Management


Besides draggin' and droppin' items t' yer quickslots, ye be also able t' equip items in this fashion, provided it be an equipment item and fits in that slot. Draggin' and droppin' be also used t' move items t' yer container window and duffle (shift + draggin' will move all items o' th' same type). Additionally, shift + right clickin' an item in yer equipment list, quickslots or container window will remove it from that slot.
corpseCarving: T' harvest potential resources from corpses, ye must carve them with a sharp item. Choose "Carve" from th' item's menu or try movin' it t' a quickslot fer ease o' use.
doodads:
Doodads be considered objects attached t' th' ground like plants, piles o' rocks, furnaces, campfires, etc. T' collect them, ye can do one o' th' following:

1. While facin' th' item, click or press th' "Actions" hotkey with {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Actions)}, and select th' "Collect Object With Hands" option.
2. Use an item with "Digging" such as a stone shovel.
3. Use an item with "Carving" such as a sharp rock.
4. Use an item with "Gather" such as a wooden pole.

Usin' yer bare hands with no tool (option 1) can sometimes harm ye. Usin' a tool (option 2/3/4) will decrease th' durability o' th' item. Some objects may require a "Carving" tool such as corpses t' harvest from them.

Note that gatherin' be a destructive process. When gatherin' from plants and mushrooms, it will attempt t' acquire all resources, thus destroyin' th' doodad. In contrast, when a plant be ready fer harvest, ye may attempt t' use th' "Harvest" action t' simply obtain only th' resources that will not destroy th' plant in th' process.
caves: Caves be th' perfect place fer hidden booty, but first, they may need illumination with a torch t' explore them further. Caves can be extremely dangerous and may require advanced armor and weaponry.
nightfall: If nightfall be approaching, come across a safe area t' camp out and prepare yerself fer combat! Many tough creatures can prowl th' night.
staminaReplenishment: If ye come across yerself gettin' exhausted, sleep or rest usin' a bedroll or hammock t' regenerate stamina. Ye can also rest by goin' into th' Actions menu and selectin' "Rest"; however, restin' with an item will produce better regenerative effects. Rest be different from sleep in that ye will only ever rest until yer stamina be maxed out. Alternatively, ye may hold spacebar or click yer character t' skip turns.
healthProblems: If ye find yerself injured, ye replenish yer health with food or healing-type items. Some status effects reduce yer ability t' regenerate yer health includin' bleedin' and poisonin'. Alternatively, ye can also try sleepin' or restin' t' regenerate health.
bleeding: Th' bleedin' status effect be usually th' result o' a low anatomy skill percentage while fightin' a tough creature. Make sure t' use a healin' item t' belay th' bleeding, such as a bandage or tourniquet. Bleedin' causes ye t' starve/dehydrate faster, regenerate stamina slower, and belays regeneration o' health.
poisoned: Poisonin' can happen from eatin' bad things or from some types o' creatures. Make sure t' use a curin' item t' cure th' poison, such as medicinal water. Poisonin' causes ye t' starve/dehydrate faster, regenerate stamina slower, and belays regeneration o' health.
dehydration: There's many ways t' get drinkable water, but unfortunately fer you, th' largest source o' water, from th' sea be nearly undrinkable in its raw form. Ye must desalinate th' water through th' use o' a water still or flask before drinkin' it without adverse effects. Alternatively, ye may seek out a fresh water source, such as from caves, small lakes, oases, swamps or ponds. Fresh water be drinkable in it's raw form without too many bad effects; however, ye may still want t' boil it fer th' best health results.
useATool: Gatherin' resources with yer hands be difficult and harmful; try equippin' or usin' a tool t' eliminate th' chance o' injury. If ye be minin' or lumberjacking, yer weapon(s) attack value will also help gather items faster. Blunt attack weapon will help ye gather faster while mining, while slashin' weapons will help ye gather faster while lumberjackin'.
durability: If ye come across one o' yer yer tools, weapons or armor be close t' breakin' from overuse (highlighted with a red border), ye will need t' repair it usin' a hammer item or a grindstone. If ye can't find or craft an item t' repair it, it will soon break completely upon use.
death: Death be permanent. Although ye may have died, all o' th' craftin' recipes ye have discovered will be ready on yer next playthrough. Yer milestones will also carry over, providin' ye multiple startin' benefits.
consumingBadThings: Ow! Not all edible/drinkable objects should be consumed, at least not without facin' th' consequences. On th' other hand, sometimes it's worth th' risk t' gain its other effects. Consumin' bad things can sometimes result in poisonin'.
fastPickup: Ye have just looted an item from th' ground. Sometimes thar be multiple items on a tile. Pressin' th' spacebar or clickin' on yer character will gather items underneath ye without movin'.
bugs: Did ye come across an error, savvy? Would ye kindly let us know about what happened, so that we may seek t' belay this from happenin' t' other players, savvy? Ye can do so by postin' th' issue in th' Steam Discussions Bug Reports forum.
heldItems:
Yer port and starboard hand equipment slots be interchangeable. Ye can equip two weapons, two tools, two shields or some godforsaken combination in between. With both th' port and starboard hand options selected, ye will use both hands (and whatever be equipped in each slot) in combat and in gatherin'. Ye can disable either th' port or starboard hands t' disable usin' that one in attackin' and gatherin'. Disablin' both will prevent ye from attackin' or gatherin' automatically.

T' receive a parryin' defense bonus, ye must be holdin' an item in each hand (one t' parry with, one t' fight with).
milestones: Milestones be personalized goals and achievements. Each playthrough, ye be given an amount t' either discover or work towards. Milestones be saved after each playthrough or death. Th' more ye have completed, th' more startin' skill and stat points ye get, as well as more startin' items.
burned: Lastin' burn injuries and pain can be caused from steppin' in an open flame without protection, or possibly other sources. Pourin' liquid on yerself will soothe th' injuries and pain. Alternatively, ye can also take a swim in deep water. Keep swimmin' until th' effect subsides. Being burned will belay ye from regeneratin' health and can last awhile if untreated.
crafting:
Craftin' be simple, but has many rules!

When hoverin' over an item in th' craftin' window, ye will see which items will be used in th' craft through a highlighted border that will appear aroun' items in yer duffle. Ye will also notice that ye will use th' first instance o' a required item. Simply drag aroun' th' order o' items in yer duffle or use th' sort t' use different items in th' craft.

Usin' items in a craft that have lower durability will affect th' crafted item's durability. Additionally, usin' remarkable, exceptional or legendary items in a craft increases yer chances t' craft such an item. Decayable items (such as food) also gain decay bonuses from usin' higher quality items in th' craft.

Ye can come across new craftin' recipes by gatherin' th' required items in yer duffle and by findin' old instructional scrolls.
encumberance: Th' first level o' encumberance will slow down yer movement and reduce stamina regeneration. Th' second level, "overburdened" will physically hurt ye as ye will begin t' take damage while tryin' t' move. Ye can drop items from yer duffle by right clicking, through th' item's menu, or by draggin' and droppin' them on t' th' game screen.
dailyChallengeMode: Daily challenge mode be an extra difficult game mode with some unique game rules t' add an extra challenge fer skilled players. Ye can expect more creatures, a harder beginnin' o' th' game, and more. Ye cannot save yer game in this mode. Th' world and randomization be unique per day, allowin' multiple players t' play in th' same set o' circumstances.
movingItems:
Thar be many ways t' organize and move items in Wayward

1. Draggin' and dropping: Ye can drag and drop items into a container window, quickslot, equipment slot, or directly on t' th' ground, by draggin' it t' th' desired location. Draggin' and droppin' t' th' game screen will drop it in front o' ye, or inside a chest if ye be facin' one. Holdin' Shift while draggin' will drag/drop all items o' th' same type.
2. From th' item's menu. Right clickin' an item will display th' item's menu with options t' "Drop/Drop All", or if ye have a container window open, will present ye th' option t' "Move/Move All". If ye click an item that has a special quality, additional options will be visible t' Drop/Move all o' th' same quality.
3. Right clicking/droppin'. Ye can shift + right click some godforsaken item in yer duffle t' drop it in front o' ye. This will automatically drop it into a chest if ye be facin' one.

Note: Ye can change th' default drop direction from th' facin' tile t' underneath yer character in th' game's option menu.
craftingFailure:
All crafts in Wayward have a skill level assosiated with them. Hoverin' over each craft will reveal th' item's craft skill level. These levels goin' from easiest t' harder be: simple, intermediate, advanced, and expert.

Tryin' t' craft an item with a higher skill level than yer own craftin' skill can sometimes result in failure. Yer chance t' successfully craft th' item raises as yer skills increase. If th' item's skill level appears in orange, ye will have a low chance at success fer craftin' that item. Each unsucessful attempt at craftin' will reduce th' durability o' each item involved in th' craft.
reputation:
These lands be mysterious and seem t' react t' yer presence and actions. Craftin' and usin' items, killin' creatures, and performin' skills will all effect yer malignity and benignity, and thus yer reputation. Th' lower yer reputation becomes, th' more challengin' survival becomes. Havin' a high reputation assumes ye be peaceful, and these lands will act in kindness towards ye by not allowin' more difficult creatures t' spawn. Certain peaceful actions may increase yer reputation and benignity such as gardenin' or plantin' mushrooms and plants. Travellin' away t' other lands usin' boats can significantly increase yer reputation as well.

Caves will always feature th' same creatures, regardless o' reputation and durin' th' night, if yer reputation be below 0, some very dangerous creatures can spawn.
interface:
Th' windowed interface in Wayward be completely customizable. Ye can move them aroun' as ye see fit, and resize them t' expand th' information that be viewable. Move them aroun' by draggin' th' title bar o' each window. Resize them by draggin' th' corner o' th' window.

If ye be still havin' issues findin' certain items within th' duffle or craftin' windows, try usin' th' filter or sortin' features.
creatureTaming:
Violence be sometimes not th' best option! Besides runnin' away from a confrontation with th' hostile island creatures, another option be t' attempt t' tame them. T' attempt creature taming, simply face th' creature and select "Tame" from yer action menu (opened with {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Actions)}).

Sometimes attemptin' t' calm th' creature directly will not be enough. Ye can also attempt t' offer an item t' creature. Simply face th' creature, open a item's menu and select "Offer". If th' creature likes or wants th' item, it will become tamed.
combat:
Engagin' in combat with creatures may not be th' best option. In Wayward, ye be free t' attempt t' kill creatures as well as tame or flee from them. Th' strategy be up t' ye!

Many skills play an important role in yer successfulness at slayin' th' creature. Open yer skills window usin' {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Skills)} and view th' hints provided when hoverin' over skills such as tactics and parryin'. Skills be not th' only important factor when battlin' creatures. Yer weaponry and armaments also play a role. Th' combat messages will tell ye o' yer effectivenesses and inadequacies when in combat. When holdin' two items (one in each hand), ye will also receive a parryin' defense bonus (based on yer parryin' skill).
quickslots:
Openin' an item's menu t' perform actions can be tiresome. Ye can drag some godforsaken item into one o' yer 9 quickslots and use th' {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.One)}, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Two)}, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Three)}, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Four)}, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Five)}, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Six)}, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Seven)}, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Eight)}, {ui.getStringForKeyBind(KeyBind.Nine)} keybinds t' perform th' default action fer th' item. Alternatively, ye can also open th' item's menu and select "Add t' Quickslot" t' add it t' an available slot in yer quickslots bar.

Ye can select th' default action by right clickin' th' item in yer quickslot and clickin' th' x icon next t' th' action, turnin' it into a √.
resourceGathering:
T' gather resources from trees or rocks, simply move into them (this feature can be disabled in options). Ye may not always succeed in gatherin' materials (the chances be based on yer skill and tool). Ye will use whatever be in yer hands t' gather. Ye can choose what tool specifically be used in either yer port or starboard hand by selectin' which t' use at th' bottom o' yer equipment menu. It be harmful t' try t' resource gather without tools.

Alternatively, if ye do not want t' use what ye be holding, ye use an item's "Gather" action from its menu by right clickin' on it. Ye can make this easier by quickslottin' it. Review th' "Quickslots" hint fer more information on this functionality.

Some resources be not gathered in this fashion. Things like small plants and other objects attached t' th' ground (referred t' as doodads) require different methods. Review th' "Doodads" hint fer more information on these items.

amber: Fossilized tree resin. Can be melted down t' reinforce items.
animalSkull: A large hollowed-out, bleached animal skull, suitable fer craftin' into a provisional helmet.
arrow: A projectile t' be fired from a bow, crafted with an arrowhead and feather t' control flight.
stoneArrowhead: Crafted from stone and t' be used in th' craftin' o' arrows. Could also be used as a carvin' implement.
pileOfAsh: Th' powdery remains o' burned matter.
barkShield: A makeshift shield, used t' block incomin' attacks, made with tree bark and wrapped with string.
bone: A heavy, sun-bleached animal bone, suitable fer rudimentary combat, gathering, or craftin' into more useful items.
branch: A typical tree branch, useful fer a variety o' crafts or stokin' a fire.
cactusSpines: Thin, long spikes, suitable fer craftin' into makeshift needles.
cobblestoneFlooring: Primitive flooring created by placin' stones in an organized pattern, fillin' some godforsaken gaps.
cookedMeat: Adequately heated meat, safe and ready fer consumption.
earthworm: A live wrigglin' insect, effective fer bait or eatin' on its own.
fertilizer: A rich mixture o' organic materials and chemicals, suitable fer combinin' with soil t' create a fertile soil.
waterskinOfSeawater: A waterskin full o' seawater, not suitable fer drinkin' without desalination.
firePlough: A fire makin' device which uses a stick and groove method t' create heat through friction.
beggartickSeeds: Dried beggartick seeds which can be planted t' grow flowers.
fossil: A carbonized fossil o' a species long since extinct.
goldCoins: Shiny, golden coins, from a lost civilization unknown t' you.
goldenRing: A golden ring, most likely used as a sign o' wealth and power.
goldenSword: An ornate, but soft sword, forged from solid gold. Not suitable fer combat due t' its softness.
grassSeeds: Small dried grass seeds. Can be planted t' grow grass.
woodenDowels: A gatherin' o' small wooden pegs. Used as hinges in woodworkin' or as kindling in firemakin'.
largeRock: A rather large rock, handy fer craftin' many tools and devices.
leafBedroll: A provisional bed with poor insulation and scratchy half-dried leaves, used fer sleepin' or restin'.
leaves: A handful o' foliage used as compost, t' stoke a fire, or as tinder when dried.
limestone: A mineral-rich rock that can be ground into a powder. Useful fer metal and glass production.
log: A sturdy piece o' wood, useful fer construction or as a fuel fer a fire.
mortarAndPestle: Used fer grindin' and crushing, made from smooth stones.
buttonMushrooms: Long lastin' common white mushrooms. They appear safe t' consume.
nopal: A de-spined cactus pad, filled with refreshin' liquid and nutrition.
peat: A dried mass o' sponge-like plants, great fer fire fuel and compostin'.
sandstone: A soft, malleable rock, useful fer construction and tool makin'.
pileOfGravel: A large pile o' damp stone and sand.
pileOfSand: A large pile o' moist sand, useful fer makin' glass when refined.
woodenArrow: A provisional wooden projectile t' be fired from a bow. Crafted with a feather t' control flight.
stoneAxe: A simple stone axe used fer choppin' wood or as a carvin' implement.
bandage: A tattered piece o' fabric, used t' staunch wounds and prevent infection.
wovenFabric: A makeshift piece o' fibrous tissue, woven together into fabric.
cactusNeedle: A needle from a cactus plant, useful in craftin' smaller, more intricate items.
stoneShovel: A diggin' tool made o' stone, used t' collect different materials from th' ground or t' route water.
woodenSpear: A makeshift, easy t' craft huntin' weapon. Makes fer an ideal ranged weapon.
suture: A sharp needle tool with an attached thin string, used t' sew and close gapin' wounds.
raft: A small, simple boat; a smartly alternative t' swimmin'. Effective fer traversin' large expanses o' water.
rawMeat: A raw, bloody chunk o' meat. Cookin' be recommended before consumption.
flyAmanita: An odd looking, and even odder smellin' red spotted mushroom.
rope: A thick, twisted piece o' cordage, useful fer heavy-duty bindin'.
mapleSeeds: Small, winged seeds that seemingly dance and twirl in th' air as they fall from a maple tree.
badderlocks: A stringy wet mass o' seaweed. Can be used as cordage or eatin' in desperation.
sharpGlass: A semi-opaque shard o' glass, formed after meltin' sand down.
sharpRock: A sharpened rock, useful fer crafting, tool making, and carvin' when required.
smoothRock: A round, smoothed rock, useful fer many crafts.
soil: A pile o' moist dirt. Th' heavy smell o' earth permeates yer nostrils when holdin' it.
stoneSpear: A huntin' weapon crafted with a stone head, suitable as a throwin' weapon.
stones: A mass o' small rocks. Can be used fer throwin' or craftin'.
stoneWall: A series o' interlaced stones and rocks, shaped into a vertical wall structure. Can be built t' keep enemies out.
string: Woven fabric; th' cornerstone o' all craftin' materials, mainly used fer bindin'.
strippedBark: A strong, fibrous shavin' from a branch, useful fer makin' cordage.
tannedLeather: A durable, treated piece o' leather. Used in craftin' armor and other tools.
tannin: A natural treatin' agent. T' be applied on hides t' create tanned leather.
milkThistleSeeds: Small hard seeds, used fer growin' milk thistle plants.
treeBark: A tough, dense chunk o' bark, broken off from a tree. Can be used fer kindling or strippin' into cordage.
honeyFungus: A parasitic fungi, grown from a tree and possibly edible.
clematisVine: A long, windin' clematis vine, suitable fer cordage.
twigs: A small pile o' sticks and tree limbs. Mostly used fer kindling.
woodenPole: A long piece o' wood, carved and shaved down into a smooth rod from a branch or log.
bow: A bent wooden pole with a shorter string tied t' both ends. Th' tension o' th' string be used t' fire arrows.
bowDrill: An advanced fire startin' device. Uses th' string on a bow t' rotate into th' wood, reducin' much effort.
fishingNet: A checkered weave o' string with weights on each corner, used t' trap and catch fish.
rawCod: Slimy t' th' touch, but healthy and delicious t' eat. Can be cooked fer a better meal.
cookedCod: A seared, well-cooked cod, ready t' consume and enjoy.
stoneCampfire: A groupin' o' rocks shaped into a ring t' contain a fire.
pileOfSnow: A meltin' snow pile. Useful t' drink in desperate need, but be smartly!
barkTorch: A torch wrapped and bound by stripped tree bark, providin' natural oils t' increase th' life o' th' torch.
litBarkTorch: Provides light t' yer surroundings when equipped and can also be used t' start other fires.
handDrill: A rudimentary fire makin' tool which uses a stick and another piece o' wood. Both hands be used t' twist th' stick against wood, makin' friction t' create an ember fer th' fire.
smallBag: A leather pouch used fer holdin' a few items, carried at yer waist, reducin' encumbrance.
shale: A brittle but sharp carvin' implement.
sharpenedBone: A sharp bone, useful fer carvin' other objects.
grindstone: A coarse rock useful fer sanding, sharpening, and repairin' other items.
rawFishSteak: A raw piece o' fish, cut into a fillet. Good t' eat as is, but be tastier cooked.
cookedFishSteak: A cooked fish fillet, seared on th' outside and delicious.
waterskinOfDesalinatedWater: A waterskin full o' freshly desalinated seawater.
bullBoat: A boat made from leather hides and framed with curved wooden poles. Used t' travel t' new, far away lands.
refinedSand: A finely ground sand, useful in makin' glass.
spyglass: An improvised, short-range telescope, which can be used t' see slightly further away in some godforsaken direction when equipped.
flask: A glass container which can be heated t' use fer desalination, a process used t' make seawater drinkable.
rawClay: A soft, formable mud. Suitable fer buildin' materials, tool-making, and more.
rawClayBlowpipe: An unfired clay blowpipe used in glassblowin'. Unusable until it has been fired.
clayBlowpipe: A sturdy blowpipe used fer glassblowin'.
leatherBelt: Made from tanned animal hide, cut, wrapped, and stitched together t' tie aroun' th' waist.
leatherTunic: A leather garment which provides protection fer th' torso.
leatherCap: A hat made o' leather, double layered fer extra sturdiness.
leatherGorget: A circlet o' leather, bound in two, stitched together and used as neck protection.
leatherPants: Basic leather leggings with just enough paddin' t' provide some leg protection.
stoneFurnace: An enclosed structure made o' stone, which traps in th' heat t' keep a long-lasting, high-temperature fire.
sandstoneKiln: Similar t' a furnace, but constructed with holystone and in a way that allows fer proper heat distribution fer craftin' glass and clay items.
ironTongs: Durable iron tongs used t' grab hot items, protectin' yer hands from damage.
talcumPowder: Chalky and abundantly absorbent t' th' touch. An agent required fer castin' o' advanced metals.
sandCastFlask: A mold fer castin' metal into some godforsaken shape, made with green sand.
lens: Glass formed into a partially convex shape. It allows focusin' sunlight into a single location, creatin' enough heat fer a fire.
plantRoots: A tangled mess o' roots, with earth still hangin' from th' tips.
lockPick: An improvised needle and prong that should be strong enough t' pick a lock or two.
pineapple: A juicy, ripe pineapple, loaded with vitamins and thirst-quenchin' attributes.
tatteredMap: An old torn map covered with drawings and scribbles, a bit hard t' make sense o' on first glance.
coal: A black and brittle mineral, stainin' anythin' it touches, but useful as fuel.
wroughtIron: A heavily oxidized and unpurified form o' iron, used in th' forgin' o' brittle tools, weapons, and armor.
limestonePowder: A white, mineral-dense powder used in glass temperin' and th' purifyin' o' metals.
ironIngot: A solid brick o' iron, ready t' be formed or melted and cast in many ways.
backpack: Crafted with leather, it's suitable fer holdin' many items on yer back, reducin' overall weight.
rottenMeat: Acrid decomposin' animal tissue. Ye would not want t' eat this, but can be used in compost.
stoneHammer: A rudimentary stone hammer, braced on th' end o' a pole with string. Used fer gatherin' and repairin'.
rawChicken: A small, plump and de-feathered cackle carcass, ready fer cookin'.
cookedChicken: A well-cooked cackle, ready t' consume and sure t' satisfy.
stoneAnvil: A solid stone anvil. Used in th' production o' metal armor, weapons, and tools.
woodenChest: A large wooden container that can fit many items while placed on th' ground. Foods will decay slower within it.
ironSword: A strong, sharp blade designed fer thrustin' and slashin'.
ironBreastplate: Durable, armor worn over th' torso. One could take a serious beatin' while wearin' this.
ironBoots: Heavy iron plated boots, shieldin' yer feet from damage.
ironHelmet: Iron plated headgear designed t' withstand heavy blows.
ironGorget: A round metal brace worn aroun' th' neck and over th' shoulders.
ironGreaves: Iron leggings; t' be strapped on and function as leg protection.
ironGauntlets: Iron gloves designed t' be protective and durable, while maintainin' as much flexibility as possible.
ironShield: A large and heavy iron shield, used fer blockin' projectiles or melee attacks.
sandstoneWall: A constructed wall built from mined holystone.
sandstoneFlooring: A group o' holystone bricks, placed in a grid t' be used as flooring.
spiderSilk: A delicate but strong strand o' silk, produced by a spider. Can be used as cordage.
animalFat: A gelatinous shavin' o' animal fat, slimy t' th' touch. Useful as a rendered fuel.
animalFatTorch: A torch; wrapped in rendered animal fat, producin' a long-lastin' light source.
clayFlakes: Dried shavings o' clay. Created by shavin' clay and dryin' over a period o' time.
greenSand: A form o' malleable sand made with clay, used t' make molds fer metal castin'.
oldInstructionalScroll: A tattered sheet o' paper with some roughly scribbled instructions and diagrams.
slimeGelatin: A lump o' slime gelatin which jiggles upon yer touch. Can be used t' preserve food, or melted down and used as glue.
glue: A natural form o' glue that can be used t' bind and reinforce items.
cookedSpiderMeat: Crispy spider meat. Not th' best texture or flavor, but contains th' more edible portions o' th' deceased arachnid.
spiderMeat: A spider's fleshy innards. It's hard t' stomach, even when cooked. Try not t' think about what you're eatin'.
ironLockPick: A pair o' iron picks and wrenches, durable enough t' pick th' most adept o' locks.
rottingVegetation: A stinkin' mash o' organic plant matter, now usable as compost. Unless ye want t' risk eatin' it.
chives: A strong smellin' and tastin' plant, packed with nutrients and vitamins.
ironHammer: A strong hammer with an iron head, perfect fer shapin' and repairin' items.
ironShovel: A heavy iron diggin' implement, liftin' and breakin' through even th' toughest gravels and soils.
ironDoubleAxe: An axe with a forged, double sided head, ideal fer both combat and gatherin'.
ironPickaxe: A robust minin' implement, with a blade forged from iron.
inkstick: A hardened brick o' ink, used fer drawin' and paintin'.
coconut: A fibrous and heavy fruit. Difficult t' consume, but packed with plenty o' caloric-dense coconut meat and milk.
palmLeaf: A large leaf from a palm tree. Th' strong inner fibers o' th' leaf be perfect fer cordage.
offal: A mound o' organs, tissue, and other undesirable portions o' an unlucky animal.
boneFragments: A bundle o' bones from a small vertebrate. Some cracked, others shattered. Th' pieces be quite sharp.
litPoleTorch: A wooden pole that has been lit on fire. Not suitable fer long journeys in th' darkness.
cotton: A downy bundle o' opened cotton seeds, th' ideal solution fer spinnin' thread and makin' fabrics.
cottonSeeds: De-fluffed and cleaned off cotton seeds, ready t' plant.
cottonFabric: A soft piece o' cloth spun from cotton.
tourniquet: A hard stud twisted together with a string. Used t' twist aroun' a bleedin' wound t' stem th' flow o' blood.
wroughtIronPickaxe: A dual-headed minin' implement. One head be heavy and blunt, th' other, spiked t' cut through rock with ease.
wroughtIronDoubleAxe: A dual-bladed axe which can provide enough slashin' damage fer both combat and gatherin'.
wroughtIronShovel: A shovel with an angled, pointed head, useful fer diggin' and water routin'.
wroughtIronHammer: A large mallet crafted from wrought iron. Useful fer repairin' and sometimes gatherin'.
wroughtIronLockPick: A set o' picks and wrenches made from wrought iron, used fer pickin' and unlockin' locked devices.
wroughtIronShield: A sturdy wrought iron shield, made by bendin' large sheets o' metal into shape.
wroughtIronGauntlets: Intricate and sturdy, these wrought iron gloves fit snugly on yer hands.
wroughtIronGreaves: Wrought iron leggings, strapped and padded aroun' th' legs t' reduce most damage.
wroughtIronGorget: A molded piece o' metal, used t' protect th' area aroun' th' neck and shoulders.
wroughtIronHelmet: Usin' a barbute design, this iron helmet shields th' head from most kinds o' attacks.
wroughtIronBoots: Wrought iron footwear. Heavy and made specifically fer protectin' feet and lower legs.
wroughtIronBreastPlate: A large wrought iron chest plate, worn over th' torso.
woodenWall: A sturdy set o' bound logs, formin' a protective wall that can be placed.
woodenFlooring: Wooden floor boards; planed t' equal height and length.
fishingRod: A flexible, smooth wooden rod with a string line and sharpened hook. Used fer fly fishin'.
pileOfCompost: A mix o' decayin' organic matter, full o' chemical nutrients and great fer growin' plants with when combined with soil.
meltedAmber: Warmed amber resin; used t' create a hardened bind when cooled on t' an object.
woodenShavings: A dry bunch o' wooden shavings, used t' ignite kindling when startin' a fire.
deadfall: A large, flat rock, propped up with a stick. Once set, anythin' that triggers it will be crushed or injured from th' fallin' rock.
snare: A short pole pushed into th' ground with a string attached. Designed t' ensnare creatures in its slipknot.
waterskinOfMedicinalWater: A soothin' mixture o' plants and roots. Used t' heal poisons and illnesses.
charcoalBandage: A cloth bandage, coated in charcoal and used fer its natural antiseptic and anticoagulant properties.
woodenTongs: A pair o' simple wood tongs, used t' loot hot objects without injury.
wroughtIronTongs: A pair o' tongs, forged from wrought iron. Used t' lift hot objects without injury.
sheetOfGlass: A cloudy tempered piece o' glass. Practical fer many optical tools and other simple devices used t' harness th' sun.
solarStill: A still that collects condensation and filters it into in a hole beneath th' glass, desalinatin' th' water and drainin' it into a container.
stoneWaterStill: A hollowed-out rock with a stone lid. It's used t' desalinate water by boilin' it and then collectin' th' steam into a separate container.
sundial: A stone timepiece that uses th' location o' th' sun or moon t' show th' approximate time o' day or night.
litAnimalFatTorch: A bright burning, pleasant smellin' torch. Made with a pole and long lasting, rendered animal fat.
sinew: Strong and flexible animal tissue. Commonly used fer makin' bows or simple cordage.
shortBow: A bow designed fer powerful shots at close range.
longBow: Nearly as tall as th' average person, this bow be designed fer maximum range.
compositeBow: An expertly crafted bow, designed fer both velocity and force.
waterskinOfPurifiedFreshWater: A full waterskin o' fresh, safe-to-drink water.
waterskinOfUnpurifiedFreshWater: Unpurified and possibly hazardous water. It be recommended ye purify th' water before drinkin'.
glassBottle: A transparent vessel with a cork fer containment. Used fer collectin' water.
cork: A small cork plug. Crafted from rubbery tree bark; it can be used t' contain liquids in bottles and other containers.
glassBottleOfSeawater: Filled t' th' top with seawater. While seawater be technically drinkable, it will not reduce yer thirst.
glassBottleOfDesalinatedWater: A bottle filled with clear seawater that has been processed t' remove th' salt content.
glassBottleOfMedicinalWater: A bottled concoction o' herbs and nutrients. Used t' cure thirst, poisons, and other ailments.
glassBottleOfPurifiedFreshWater: glass bottle o' purified fresh water
Potable, and safe t' hydrate yerself with. Th' water has been purified reducin' some godforsaken toxins and unsafe bacteria.
glassBottleOfUnpurifiedFreshWater: glass bottle o' unpurified fresh water
A bottle containin' water that be likely unfit t' drink. It will quench yer thirst, but may have negative side-effects until it's purified.
wroughtIronArrow: An arrow with a wrought iron arrowhead. Th' shaft o' th' arrow be long and be fletched with feathers.
ironArrow: An arrow tipped with a high-quality iron arrowhead. Fletched with feathers t' stabilize flight and accuracy.
stoneBullet: A basic stone projectile fer slings and firearms. Smooth and more or less spherical in shape.
wroughtIronBullet: A small ball o' wrought iron, used as ammunition fer slingshots or firearms.
leatherQuiver: A leather-bound, back-mounted container designed t' hold arrows; however, other items will also fit inside as well.
ectoplasm: A ghostly, weightless fluff o' misty goo, strangely self-contained and smartly evaporatin'.
magicalEssence: An odd transparent powder with organic and ethereal materials. This magical matter may be used on items t' affix magical properties on t' them.
woodenFence: A section o' wooden fencing, constructed from two logs and held together with horizontal beams.
creatureIdol: A mass o' animal organs, crudely shaped into some kind o' figure. It smells awful and emits an odd hummin' noise, and appears t' attract creatures.
cordedSling: A thick piece o' cordage, wrapped and bound with a slot made fer a projectile. Used t' swing ammunition, increasin' throwin' range.
leatherSling: A sling crafted from tanned leather. Designed t' hold a projectile t' be thrown at an increased velocity.
wroughtIronArrowhead: Forged with wrought iron, this arrowhead be used t' craft an arrow. In dire need, it could also be used fer carvin'.
ironArrowhead: An expertly forged iron arrowhead, used t' create arrows. Alternatively, can be used t' carve if necessary.
hammock: A comfortable place t' sleep, although not too sturdy. Crafted by bound cordage and usually hung off o' th' ground.
cottonBedroll: A soft and downy sleepin' mattress, rolled up fer ease o' carryin'. Can be used t' sleep or rest very comfortably.
featherBedroll: A bedroll made with soft feathers and wrapped in fabric. Used fer restin' and sleepin' in comfort.
rawTaintedMeat: A piece o' bad-smellin' meat, possibly diseased or tainted with parasites. Possible t' consume, but could be deadly.
cookedTaintedMeat: A piece o' discolored meat, cooked t' kill possible toxins, but possibly still unsafe fer consumption.
stoneKnife: A sharpened piece o' stone, carved into a blade, with a handle fer support. Can be used as a weapon, gatherin' tool or t' carve.
rawBlindfish: An odd-lookin' fish with no eyes. Very slimy t' th' touch.
cookedBlindfish: While th' source o' th' food be a bit suspect, after being cooked, it appears t' be more palatable.
pemmican: A ball o' dried ground meat. With a long shelf life, this be th' ultimate survival food. Fer th' best benefits, prepare it with animal fat.
preparedPemmican: A seasoned mound o' dried ground meat, fried and cooked with fat fer maximum flavor and caloric content.
sail: A large piece o' fabric, woven together t' be attached t' a mast. Used on a sailboat t' propel it along th' sea.
sailboat: A large one-man boat. Used t' traverse large expanses o' water and fer travel back t' civilization.
egg: A brown colored cackle fruit, laid by a cackle. Can be eaten as is, or cooked fer a tastier meal.
boiledEgg: A moist, delicious boiled cackle fruit. Great tastin' and packed with protein.
sheafOfHay: Long and almost sharp t' th' touch. These grass stalks be perfect fer string making, animal feed, or tinder when dried.
niter: A natural mineral, ground up t' be used as a preservative or fer other chemical applications.
saltpeter: A ground mineral, t' be used as a natural food preservative. If combined with other minerals, it can be combustible.
blackPowder: A highly combustible powder, made up o' a combination o' minerals.
flintlockPistol: A long range, high damage pistol. Requires black powder and bullets t' fire.
giblets: A batch o' cooked animal organs. Considerably repugnant, but nutritious and fillin'.
explosiveTrap: A mound o' leaves used t' conceal a volatile explosive powder. Steppin' on it will trigger a small explosion.
skeletalMageWand: A mysterious, gnarled staff with a twinklin' red gemstone attached t' th' end.
rawClayJug: A formed and sculpted jug molded from raw clay. Requires a cork and a kiln t' be fired and hardened.
clayJug: A fully hardened clay jug with a cork. Used t' hold water.
clayJugOfSeawater: Unfiltered seawater, held in a clay jug. Unsuitable t' drink in its current form but could be desalinated.
clayJugOfDesalinatedWater: Potable, safe-to-drink water. Th' water in this clay jug has gone through th' desalination process.
clayJugOfMedicinalWater: A clay jug containin' medicinal water, used t' cure and soothe certain ailments while also replenishin' yer thirst.
clayJugOfPurifiedFreshWater: clay jug o' purified fresh water
A clay jug filled with fresh, purified water. Can be used t' quench yer thirst.
clayJugOfUnpurifiedFreshWater: clay jug o' unpurified fresh water
A clay jug full o' natural, fresh water. Although it be drinkable, further purification be recommended.
rawClayBrick: A soft piece o' raw clay, molded into a rectangle. Ready t' be fired inside a kiln.
clayBrick: A hardened clay brick, used in th' buildin' o' structures such as floors and walls.
clayBrickWall: A wall made from clay bricks, set into a typical skewed, grid-like fashion t' increase durability.
clayBrickFlooring: Flooring crafted from clay bricks. Could be used as decoration or as part o' a buildin'.
pineappleSeeds: Small brown seeds that can be planted t' grow into pineapple plants.
pricklyPearSeeds: These appear t' be prickly pear seeds. Can be planted t' grow cacti or eaten.
clematisSeeds: Seeds t' grow clematis. Can be eaten if desperate, but they do not contain any significant nutrition.
paperSheet: A large piece o' paper. It appears t' contain many recycled fibers. Suitable fer drawin' on with ink.
paperMold: A mold used fer makin' paper. Contains a screen that holds wet recycled fibers t' dry and press into flattened, usable paper.
beggarticks: Th' flower and stems o' beggarticks. Only useful in creatin' medicinal tonics, or ingestin' directly if food supply be low.
milkThistleFlowers: Th' flowerin' bulbs o' a milk thistle plant. Filled with a bitter but nutritious milk.
drawnMap: A paper sheet, scrawled with geographical landmarks and features. Used t' approximate a location when read.
tatteredShirt: A once fine piece o' a clothing, now torn and tattered.
tatteredPants: Brown colored pants, now reduced t' shorts from distress and wear.
poisonIvyLeaves: Causes irritation t' th' touch; these leaves o' three do not belong on yer person.
poisonIvySeeds: Bright green, soft seeds, used t' plant t' grow into poison ivy.
wroughtIronChest: A spacious container built from wrought iron that can store many items. Foods will spoil slower inside o' it.
ironChest: A large iron chest that be both roomy and sturdy. Foods contained within will decay at a slower rate.
switchgrassSeeds: Long dried grass seeds. Can be planted t' grow a longer type o' grass.
apple: A juicy, delicious red apple. Th' fruit contains seeds t' grow apple trees.
spiderEggs: Soft and squishy t' th' touch. These small silken eggs contain arachnid life inside.
tailFeathers: A fluffy clump o' white feathers, removed from an avian creature's backside.
appleSeeds: Still scented like th' apples they come from, these small brown seeds be used fer plantin' t' grow into apple trees.
venomGland: Th' venom producin' gland o' a snake, still filled with some immobilizin' venom.
ornateWoodenChest: A decorative wooden container gilded with symbols inlaid into th' wood.
rollOfRedCarpet: A rolled-up piece o' red carpet, suitable fer makin' a comfortable livin' space or welcomin' important guests.
ornateCape: A red and gold stitched cape, which drapes th' back and fastens at th' neck. Worn as a status symbol.
fireBladder: An oddly shaped organ from a fire-breathin' creature. Hot t' th' touch; it appears t' contain a deadly chemical reaction inside.
woodenSword: A sturdy blunt sword, crafted from wood with a sharp piercin' point. Most useful fer sparrin' practice.
clayKiln: Similar t' a furnace, but constructed with clay and in a way that allows fer proper heat distribution fer craftin' glass and clay items.
clayCampfire: A groupin' o' clay bricks shaped into a ring t' contain a fire.
clayFurnace: An enclosed structure made o' clay bricks, which traps in th' heat t' keep a long-lasting, high-temperature fire.
clayWaterStill: A carved-out clay brick with a lid. It's used t' desalinate water by boilin' it and then collectin' th' steam into a separate container.
sandstoneCampfire: A groupin' o' holystone shaped into a ring t' contain a fire.
sandstoneFurnace: An enclosed structure made o' holystone, which traps in th' heat t' keep a long-lasting, high-temperature fire.
sandstoneWaterStill: A hollowed-out piece o' holystone with a lid. It's used t' desalinate water by boilin' it and then collectin' th' steam into a separate container.
stoneKiln: Similar t' a furnace, but constructed with rocks and in a way that allows fer proper heat distribution fer craftin' glass and clay items.
wroughtIronAnvil: An anvil made from wrought iron with a wooden base. Useful fer metalworkin'.
ironAnvil: A sturdy iron anvil. Used in th' production o' metal armor, weapons, tools, and more.
mageRobe: An ancient tattered robe, once owned by a spell castin' foe.
orbOfInfluence: A strange spherical orb that gives off a shimmerin' radiance on yer touch. It appears t' hum as ye hold it.
animalClaw: A sharp claw from an animal. A perfect animal by-product fer usin' as a needle.
animalPelt: Th' remains o' an unlucky skinned animal. Can be used as a makeshift garment or dismantled into th' hide and fur separately.
animalFur: A large clump o' animal fur and hair. Could be used as tinder in a situation whar wood be not available.
sharkFin: Not much more than a trophy, this carved dorsal fin remains slippery and rubbery t' th' touch.
rawReptileMeat: A grainy piece o' edible reptile flesh. Generally, not safe t' consume without being cooked due t' bacteria.
cookedReptileMeat: A grilled piece o' reptile meat. Th' look and texture could almost be passed as cackle.
tentacles: A slimy, wrigglin' appendage from an unlucky cephalopod. Can be eaten, but with some force due t' th' rubbery unpleasant texture.
cookedTentacles: Although, still springy t' th' touch, this cooked cephalopod appendage can be stomached much easier than if raw.
wormMeat: Essentially a mash o' worm innards, almost ground up into a paste. Definitely not th' most appetizing, but can be cooked fer better flavor.
cookedWormMeat: A cooked patty o' worm meat. Unappetizin' t' think about, but can provide as a good source o' needed nutrition.
stonePickaxe: A primitive stone pickaxe used fer minin' into rock or as a stopgap blunt weapon.
wroughtIronAxe: An axe forged out o' wrought iron, primarily used fer lumberjackin' and carvin'.
ironAxe: An iron-forged axe used in wood choppin'. Its sharp end can be used fer craftin' and carvin'.
fertileSoil: A rich soil, suitable fer settin' down t' attempt t' grow plants on fer maximum fertility.
stoneHoe: A rudimentary tillin' and gardenin' tool, used t' break up soil fer more successful growth o' plants.
wroughtIronHoe: A long pole with a wrought iron metal blade attached t' th' end. Used t' till th' ground fer plantin' seeds.
ironHoe: A long-handled gardenin' tool with a blade on th' end, forged from iron. Used t' till soil fer better plant growth.
lavaBeetleHelmet: An extremely hard and fire-resistant helmet, sourced from th' carcass o' a fallen lava beetle.
spruceSeeds: White seeds fer growin' a spruce tree, ejected from a spruce cone.
spruceNeedles: Dense, needled branches from a spruce tree. Useful fer compost or dryin' out fer tinder.
cypressCone: A rounded cone from a spruce tree, containin' seeds.
cypressSeeds: Sharp t' th' touch, these seeds can be used fer growin' cypress trees.
cypressLeaves: Flat bladed foliage from a cypress tree. Can be used fer tinder or compost when dried out.
lettuce: This leafy green vegetable be rich in vitamins and quite fillin' when eaten.
lettuceSeeds: Seeds taken from lettuce that has turned t' seed.
chiveSeeds: Th' small black appearance o' these seeds suggests they be fer growin' chives.
potato: Starchy edible tubers. Not suitable fer consumption without cookin' due t' toxicity.
potatoSeeds: An alternative way t' grow potatoes without usin' seed potatoes. These will grow into a potato plant seedlin'.
carrot: A healthy lookin' root vegetable, orange in color and full o' nutrients. Both th' taproot and leaves be edible.
carrotSeeds: Seeds fer growin' carrots, taken from seedin' carrot flowers.
cornEar: An ear o' corn, wrapped in its husk; ready t' be shucked and cooked, or eaten raw.
cornSeeds: Dried and aged corn kernels, used fer plantin' and growin' corn stalks.
cucumber: A cucumiform gourd fruit, grown from a creepin' vine. Full o' nutrients and packed with water content.
cucumberSeeds: Seeds taken from inside th' fruit o' a cucumber.
tomato: Red, plump and juicy, this savory fruit can be eaten raw fer replenishment o' hunger as well as some thirst.
tomatoSeeds: Seeds from a tomato, ready fer plantin' and germination t' grow into tomato plants.
pumpkin: A heavy orange squash, filled with edible pulp. Contains seeds fer growin' more.
pricklyPearFruit: Th' fruitin' body o' a prickly pear cactus. Th' insides be extremely red and juicy.
sugarCaneStalks: Stout, jointed, fibrous stalks that be rich in th' sugar content. They can be quite long and th' insides can be chewed on fer sustenance.
sugarCaneSeeds: Seeds fer plantin' and growin' crops o' sugar cane stalks.
bushelOfWheat: Th' clipped remains o' th' stalk and grains from wheat grass.
wheat: Th' hulled spikelets from wheat grass, containin' th' raw grains.
cookedCornCob: A well cooked cob o' corn. Ready t' consume and enjoy.
bundleOfSwitchgrass: Bundled up switchgrass stalks, complete with its seeds.

chemistry: • Influences quality and success rate o' crafted items usin' chemical mixtures.
anatomy:
• Increases accuracy o' creature health description.
  • Decreases chance o' bleedin' and poisonin'.
  • Increases effectiveness o' healin' consumables.
  • Increases success chance when healin'.
archery: • Increases attack damage, accuracy and maximum range when usin' bows and firearms.
blacksmithing: • Influences quality, repair, and success rate o' crafted items usin' metal.
botany:
• Increases chance o' successfully plantin' a plant.
  • Increases effectiveness o' eatin' plant-based consumables.
  • Decreases chance o' tramplin' plants when steppin' on them.
  • Increases chance o' gatherin' resources on plants.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction while gatherin' from plants.
camping:
• Increases th' amount o' turns slept when usin' a bedroll.
  • Increases chance o' startin' a fire.
  • Increases th' accuracy o' tellin' th' time with a sundial.
cartography:
• Increases chance t' successfully read tattered maps.
  • Decreases obscurity when readin' tattered maps.
claythrowing: • Influences quality and success rate o' craftin' items usin' clay.
cooking:
• Influences quality and success rate o' cookin' items (via crafting).
  • Influences decay o' cooked items.
fishing:
• Increases chance t' successfully catch a fish. Increases maximum range when usin' a fishin' rod.
  • Increases th' range in which ye can gather underwater booty from.
fletching: • Influences quality and repair rate o' crafted arrows, bows, and slings.
glassblowing: • Influences quality and success rate o' crafted items usin' glass.
leatherworking: • Influences quality, repair, and success rate o' crafted items usin' leather.
lockPicking: • Increases chance t' successfully unlock a chest.
lumberjacking:
• Increases chance o' gatherin' resources on trees.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction while lumberjackin'.
mining:
• Increases chance o' gatherin' resources while hittin' rock/holystone or diggin'.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction while minin' and diggin'.
  • Increases th' range in which ye can gather booty from.
mycology:
• Increases chance o' plantin' a mushroom.
  • Increases effectiveness o' eatin' mushroom consumables.
  • Decreases chance o' tramplin' mushrooms when steppin' on them.
  • Increases chance o' gatherin' resources on mushrooms.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction while gatherin' from mushrooms.
parrying:
• Increases yer base defense value when holdin' an item in each hand.
  • Increases chance t' take less damage in combat.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction from being attacked.
stonecrafting: • Influences quality, repair, and success rate o' crafted items usin' stones and rocks.
swimming:
• Increases speed in water travel.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction in water.
tactics:
• Increases yer base attack value.
  • Increases chance t' hit targets in combat.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction while attackin'.
tailoring: • Influences quality, repair, and success rate o' crafted items usin' cloth and leather.
throwing: • Increases attack damage, accuracy, and maximum range when throwin' or slingin' an item.
tinkering: • Influences quality, repair, and success rate o' crafted items usin' miscellaneous resources and methods.
trapping:
• Increases th' amount o' damage and success rate o' trappin' creatures.
  • Reduces chance o' settin' off traps and reduces damage taken from traps.
woodworking: • Influences quality, repair, and success rate o' crafted items usin' wood.
taming:
• Increases chance o' successfully tamin' a creature.
  • Increases length o' time creature will be tamed fer.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction when taming/offerin'.
gardening:
• Increases chance o' successfully tillin' or harvestin'.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction while tillin' or harvestin'.
  • Influences quality and success rate o' craftin' items requirin' gardenin' skill.

fire: A dangerous open flame providin' heat and light.
honeyFungus: a parasitic tree fungus that can grow and spread on livin', decayin', and dead plant material.

menuAboutIntro: Wayward be a turn-based, top-down, wilderness survival roguelike currently in beta. It's brought t' ye by these fine folk:
menuAboutLibrariesIntro: Wayward be made possible with th' followin' projects:
menuManageModsMessage: Open Steam Workshop t' Install Mods
menuNewGameOptionsCasualDescription: Dyin' will respawn ye in th' last place ye rested or slept. All items will be dropped at th' location o' yer demise.
menuNewGameOptionsHardcoreDescription: Th' default and definitive way t' play. Permanent character death be enabled.
optionsAlternateContextMenuTooltip: If checked, left clickin' items will display th' item's menu instead o' right click. Shift + right click actions also turn into just right click actions.
optionsAutoGatherTooltip: If checked, ye will automatically gather when movin' into resource tiles.
optionsAutoPickupTooltip: If checked, ye will automatically loot items as ye move on top o' them.
optionsDeveloperLoggingTooltip: Enable verbose loggin' fer language and mod debuggin'.
optionsDirectionTurnDelayTooltip: Th' amount o' movement delay that occurs after switchin' a direction or turnin'.
optionsDropOnGatherTooltip: If checked, ye will automatically drop items under yer character as ye gather them.
optionsDropUnderYourselfTooltip: If checked, droppin' items will place them at yer feet instead o' t' th' adjacent facin' tile.
optionsEnableHintsTooltip: If checked, th' game will display unseen hints when triggered.
optionsKeepSortActiveTooltip: If checked, yer duffle will keep sortin' automatically as ye get items.
optionsMouseClickMovementTooltip: If checked, ye will be able t' tap or use yer mouse t' move on screen.
optionsProtectedCraftingItemsTooltip: If checked, equipped and quickslotted items won't be used in craftin'.
optionsRightClickInspectTooltip: If checked, right clickin' th' game screen will automatically inspect th' tile instead o' bringin' up th' actions menu (instead o' havin' t' use shift + right click).
optionsSkipIntroTooltip: If checked, th' game will skip th' Unlok logo screen.
optionsWarnOnDangerousActionsTooltip: If checked, a confirmation screen will display when steppin' over doodads or objects that could injure you.
optionsWarnWhenBreakingItemsTooltip: If checked, a confirmation screen will display when tryin' t' craft usin' items that will break on failure.
optionsWorldTooltipsTooltip: If checked, hoverin' over non-empty tiles will reveal information in a tooltip so ye don't have t' inspect.
optionsZoomOnScrollTooltip: If checked, ye will be able t' zoom in and out in game usin' yer mouse wheel/zoom gesture.
